controller

Class PokeController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.PokeController

  • public class PokeController
extends java.lang.Object
    PokeController is responsible for connecting listeners to the Pokemon.fxml file to variables in the PokemonCollection class. PokeController is also responsible for updating the poke.txt file to be user for Pokemon.fxml's TableView.
    Author:
    Brenda Trejo

    • Constructor Detail

      • PokeController

        public PokeController()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        initialize initializes the cells in the TableView to their respective variables in the PokemonCollection. initialize also pre-populates the TableView with the data in poke.txt.

      • backButtonHandle

        public void backButtonHandle()
        backButtonHandle is responsible for returning to Collectibase's main screen and saves any new entered information to poke.txt before exiting.

      • updateButtonHandle

        public void updateButtonHandle()
        updateButtonHandle is responsible for updating the TableView and poke.txt file whenever pressed.

      • insertButtonHandle

        public void insertButtonHandle()
        insertButtonHandle is responsible for inserting any text in the text fields onto the TableView. Empty fields are also accounted for. After the fields have been inserted they are cleared and poke.txt is updated.

      • deleteButtonHandle

        public void deleteButtonHandle()
        deleteButtonHandle deletes a selected field or row from the TableView. poke.txt is also updated by deleting the respective fields from the file.

      • cellValueFactory

        public void cellValueFactory()
        cellValueFactory is responsible for connecting the variable columns with it's respective variable in PokemonCollection. cellValueFactory also allows for a single cell to be edited when double clicked.

      • changeRarity

        public void changeRarity(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<PokemonCardCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)
        The methods below update a single variable of a collection when it's cell is double clicked.
        Parameters:
        edditedCell: - the cell that was edited in the TableView will be the variable that is changed in the collection.

      • changeCondition

        public void changeCondition(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<PokemonCardCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • changeValue

        public void changeValue(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<PokemonCardCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • changeName

        public void changeName(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<PokemonCardCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • changeSeries

        public void changeSeries(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<PokemonCardCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • changeSet

        public void changeSet(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<PokemonCardCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • changeType

        public void changeType(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<PokemonCardCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • writePokeFile

        public void writePokeFile()
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        writePokeFile is responsible for writing to the poke.txt file in order to frequently update the TableView.
        Throws:
        Exception: - In the case that the collection has not been created, the poke.txt file is not found.
        java.lang.Exception

      • getPokeFromFile

        public void getPokeFromFile()
        getPokeFromFile updates the TableView in the Pokemon.fxml by reading what is in poke.txt.
